{{quote|[Beren] swore. . . an oath of vengeance.  First therefore he pursued the Orcs that had slain his father and his kinsmen, and he found their camp by night at Rivil's Well. . .|[[The Silmarillion]], [[Of Beren and Lúthien]]}}

'''Rivil's Well''' was the spring of the river [[Rivil]], flowing from [[Dorthonion]] above the [[Fen of Serech]].  

It was here where an [[Orc]]-band, after [[Massacre at Tarn Aeluin|killing]] [[Barahir]] and his [[XII Bëorings|followers]], camped. Their captain boasted about his deeds, holding the severed hand of [[Barahir]], still with [[Ring of Barahir|his Ring]] on it. [[Beren]], having followed their traces, avenged his father by slaying the captain, while recapturing his father's hand. He fled leaving the Orcs aimless and dismayed.<ref>{{S|Beren}}</ref>
